reviews.text: It's a well maintained palace, unlike most other Indian palaces. You can spend an hour or two, depending on your taste. There is a significant amount of walking to be done inside, so avoid going afternoon. Also visit in-house vintage car museum. The cars are in amazing shape. DO HIT THE LIKE BUTTON IF THIS WAS HELPFUL.

The palace is one of the well maintained palaces of India.

The sculpture and collection of armory will make you wonder, it's also a huge place.

You will also have view of vintage cars, once used by the royal family of Hyderabad. 

The Rolls Royce Silver Ghost 1912 model and many more.

I enjoyed.
Best place to get that historical vibes. It's just Beautiful. So much to see and so many pictures you can click. Make sure that the weather is cool, if it's hot you may not enjoy.

Awesome place to spend time with friends and family for 2 to 3 hrs... Has good collection of vintage cars and buggies... Nice location for photography and photoshoot... Has good antique collection of Jewellery for sale... Everyone should visit once in life to Chowmahalla palace.
Pretty awesome place but just for clicking pictures. You'd definitely see some of the very rare cars and their swords and pottery in there. In all a good place to visit.

Another marvelous fort in India. Better go in the evening, you can enjoy the beautiful of the fort when its eliminated with lights. You will need stamina to climb the stairs. What an engineering marvel. If you are visiting with family, better to get a guide so you can get to know about the history of the place. Can easily spend half day here. Overall amazing experience.

This is the beautiful fort and well maintained it's a great place if you are interested in architecture there are many tourists guides they will you the history of that place behind the stories everywhere.......
A place worth a visit of trying to cover special places of Hyderabad well maintained might get tired of travelling with kids light show of evening is good but it can be improved and the only downside is steps that you have to climb and finally it's a wonderful place...

This is the beautiful fort. well maintained. Great place if you are interested in architecture. There are many tour guides that will help you with the history of that place behind the stories everywhere. "The only negative step that you have to climb up". Make sure you are in the best of your endurance! This is more challenging because the flight of the whole step is in the scorching sun. Do not forget your  sunglasses, hat and umbrella or cap and water as it will be very sunny. Washrooms are available. A little shaded place where someone can relax. It's better to go early in the morning because the sunlight will be less. 
Your trip to Hyderabad is not complete without visiting Golkonda Fort, you should visit once. Such a wonderful monument !! Good place to spend with both family and friends
You can see the city's good view from the fort. " Importantly If you are interested in history, then rent a guide from the ticket counter."

Its a great piece of architecture. The fort is well maintained and clean. One will require an average time of 3 hrs to see the fort. Clean washrooms are available. One has to carry enough water as the journey to the interiors is a tedious one. Its better to visit the place early in the morning. The fort represents the cultural heritage of Hyderabad. One can also visit the light show in the evening. It is definitely a mesmerizing site. I'll highly recommend this place.

What a Fort on the Deccan plateau. Must visit when in Hyderabad. Should take a guide. Will definitely enhance your experience in roaming around the fort. Such thought and super planning gone in making such forts is worth giving a thought. The sound through the walls amazed me to infinity. The clap room was out of this world.

A historic holy and spiritual place near Charminar in Hyderabad. A few regulations are made on the dress code since it's a religious place. Well maintained and is kept clean and tidy. Many ancient things are present here.

It is open place for all types of religion people. The architecture is very beautiful and can't resist our eyes to watch. Some people will enjoy the prayer's and some will enjoy by watching the birds. There are many nearby places here to visit. Almost all the time of a day is full of crowd.

historical Masjid. inside masjid not allowed renovation work is happening. all humans are allowed inside the campus, u can enjoy the place with water fountain and more pigeons are there.luggage not allowed inside. there is a cloak room near security room with less charge
A place where you meet history and modern world together...it gives you a divine mental peace and the cities conondrum. The serenity is really awesome.good place to go

It is believed that Bricks used in construction of this masjid are made from the clay which was bought from the muslims holy place MECCA. It is one of the largest mosques in South India which accommodates nearly 10,000 people. Masjid is made up of finest quality of granite.

One of the finest colleges under Osmania University in Hyderabad. The Arts college is pretty large compared to other University arts colleges. Good ambience and its architectural style needs special mentioning. Overall its good
Good and calm place. I was hanging out with my family near by college greenery.
One of the oldest historical monument fine architecture
Experience was good here but the maintenance is very poor
Top university in Telangana and one of the best university in India
We should take care of our heritagrous structure which give us dignity.
Not maintained so well by trust .

This is one of the key museum to know more about the Nizam's if Hyderabad. This was an official residence of Nizam constructed by Asaf Jha II for his son Sikandar Jha. Later seventh and last Nizam of Hyderabad Mir Osman Ali Khan converted this place to the museum which houses the artifacts of Nizam and many other items related to the era. This palace also has manual lift and a huge corridor with wooden cupboards used by 6th Nizam to keep his clothes and other accessories. Now Purani Haveli also houses school and South zone DCP police office. This palace needs good maintenance and the government need to take the palace restoration project with uttermost seriousness.
Its a nice experience to know the history of nizams era as rulers.
Nizam museum known in this area as Purani Haveli. Entry is through a small lane.
Its a quiet place in midst of concrete jungle, and it offers nice view of the surrounding as it is on a small hill

A good place to see, it's built in memory of Monsieur Raymond. But every one disappointed after coming to this place. Not given importance by the state and central governments. No facilities are available. Not covered in tourism department eventhough it's a national heritage centre.
It is a mind-blowing tourist place and also very good for photo shoots...but the place is not neat near rocks . Cow dung is there...
It's monument in rememberence of Monsieur Raymond , good view from top

The place is ill treated and ill maintained. After reaching there one will not say that it is a national heritage site by looking at the conditions. Rather than the locals have made it a place to sit and booze. The place has lost its significance. The whole place was stinking. You can find sapling growing on top of the relics, might actually can lead into the destruction of it. Near by surrounding was more like a jungle as it wasn't been taken care of. The place is quite but those people who came there with liquor and weed etc.  has actually impacted the significance of the place to the visitors.
Beautiful in it's own kind. One of Historical monument of Qutub shahi dynasty. Masjid was constructed in early 1600 A.D. People come here in good number for praying.

Amazing structure but unfortunately not maintained. 
Big space for parking. 
Very cool inside even in summer.
Thanks for the god of hope and pray for you
It's ok
One of the encient mosque in the city.. Beautifully architectured .. Very seren and seclusion place...

One of the most beautiful temples and the view from the temple is spectacular. Plus while going around the temple while praying you get a complete view. Best time to Visit either early morning or late evenings. Unfortunately no mobile phones allowed so couldn't take photographs of the temple in the sunset setting.. Maintained well and a definitely a go to place even for inner peace.. Off season no crowd makes it more peaceful.. The combination of landscape and marble is just spectacular..

Had a great time in this temple. Design which is carved on the stone is unique and you will be amazed by looking at the sculptures. It was mind blowing and you will find this place to be peaceful and from the top you can see the city. 
I personally enjoyed a lot and was really happy and if you are going to Hyderabad then it is worth visiting this place.

I love to visit Birla Mandir across India. Every state I visit, I make sure to visit Birla Mandir in that state. Although no temple is big or small beautiful or otherwise, I personally love the grander of Kolkata Birla temple. but if there is some other Birla temple I really love it is Hyderabad Birla Mandir. The beautiful architecture marble the hill top view everything is picture perfect. Just be careful as the road to the temple is quite narrow and parking can be of an issue.

Great place to visit in the evenings. Its calm and peaceful. The architecture is amazing and it leaves you in awe!! First is temple visit which generally takes around 30 to 45 minutes to cover. You can spend a pretty good time in the shopping where they have nice collection of books, decorative articles etc. Books are my stuff so i generally spend more time there. And the street shopping after the temple visit is okayish. Selling innovative products might be more attractive.

This is a well maintained busy temple located on a hill top. One can climb through the steps or go in a car. One can get a good view of the city from the temple. RTC bus service is available to visit this temple. Children will definitely enjoy their visit to this temple.

A nice place to remember your Nostalgia, but only most of the goods being sold are apparel and fabrics. The innovative stalls where we could find some gadgets are very, very few in number. You get excellent deals if you are an able bargainer. Otherwise the stalls are routine. Most of the big brands have disappeared totally from the scene.

Good place for buying things from bedding, dining, real estate and especially kitchen ware you will find multiple kinds and varieties of things to buy for kitchen.
Will find different kinds of eatables.

Coming to fun part, they are providing almost 20 rides/games for which we need to pay individually for each ride.

Finally the ultimate thing is the dressing for girls and women
Lots lots of varieties of dresses available for them to buy.

In a way you can spent some good time if you like to spend time in crowded places.

P.S if you don’t like crowds then please don’t visit, at least on week ends.

You can find everything you want in one place. There are many stalls for clothes , fabrics and other crafts. The hand made crafts are really good. You ll love  home made chocolates in many flavors. Kids will love their being here. Commuting to this place is also easy through metro. ( Right next to the Nampally metro station). One thing I didn't like is not all the food stalls are tasty.

The exhibition is a great place to go if you are looking for a good time and range of things to buy. It's usually crowded. Be prepared to bargain. Use experience to guess the quality of things being sold. Most stall owners are helpful and kind. Food is good. Rides are fun for people of all ages.

Annual celebrations event. A popular, prestigious and historic one in Hyderabad. Very good. One can have plenty of varieties in clothing, crockery, artificial jewellery, type of food both veg and non veg, gift items, some noted companies stalls, all regular items etc. One can have a nice experience. However one should have bargain knowledge or approx rates of items of which they are looking for.

Ideally located, with good parking facility. Lot of greenery. Useful for public meetings, dramas, plays, and functions. Fully air-conditioned. Seating arrangement is just like in a Cinema theatre. I like it very much. Dining hall at cellar is spacious.
This one is old school but good. You have a center hall for marriage and from floor above marriage or function can be watched while having dinner alongside. Its more of a standing gallery.
Spacious halls...not sure if every one get the hall booked...
Best Kalyana Mandapam for events , weddings, meetings, party's..very expensive.and good place in vst cross roads..Nice place. maintained by RTC Department.
It's good for middle level function,  great parking place and it's theater view from top to bottom,  great experience for viewers everyone get chance to view.

One of the best place to visit, enjoy , clip photos, do activities and many more at a place.There are boats, sculptures, forest ponds, gardens, traditional market and many lovely things to view and buy. It's wonderful place. What a great atmosphere.

Very good place to visit with family, friends and with partner. You will see shops selling the hand made goods. They are little costlier but worth of buying it. I went to this place with my family. We enjoyed a lot here. There is so much place to roam inside. So get ready for leg pains :P. Food court is also there inside it. You will see many hand made statues, sculptures every where inside this place. And you can see some structures made out of iron, plastic wastes. Kids play area is also there.

Shilparamam is the best weekend hangout point for the whole family. Especially, evenings are the best times to visit and see the beauty of life. You can have ⛵ boating, handicrafts shopping, some times music, see and learn about village culture of olden days, find birds and animals of some sort lots more.

There are over 250 stalls which sell clothing materials, shawls, fancy jewelleries, wooden craft materials etc. On average people may spend 2 hours here. Afternoons are going to be very hot so its recommended to go in evenings. Ancient village life of people are very well shown with statues.

Good for family outing. Go in the early hours else it will be too much heat ...

Bargain a lot as people will offer discounts only based on the persistence shown...

Nice waterboat ride
I don't know how many years of history it has, but looks like it is very ancient temple.. I felt very peaceful when I was there.. some positivity reflects..🙏🙏

Very old temple with good vibes.  A minute of meditation will give good peace of mind  inspite of the fact that the temple is located in busy market place.  Parking facilities could be improved  and wheel chair asseciability can be done.

Famous during the bonalu season. Bonalu here are called also as Lashkar bonalu. People coming by car could face parking problem but by two wheeler it is easily accessible and you can park your bike behind the temple or nearby.
It is one of the oldest temple in the city and most reverred by the locals.

There is old story behind this Temple, which I am not sure of it's authenticity. It was built during times when Hyderabad had full-fledge military base in sainikpuri. It bought lot faith among army people.later it was shifted to Secunderabad because sainikpuri had space limitations and army restrictions. Today it is located in Secunderabad, a well known spot in commercial area surrounded by textile shops and gold-silver article dealers. suggest you to reach here via taxi or two-wheeler since it doesn't have much parking space or wider roads.Its a crowded place during weekdays. The temple has lots of positivity in and around.
I don't know how many years of history it has, but looks like it is very ancient temple.. I felt very peaceful when I was there.. some positivity reflects..🙏🙏

Very old temple with good vibes.  A minute of meditation will give good peace of mind  inspite of the fact that the temple is located in busy market place.  Parking facilities could be improved  and wheel chair asseciability can be done.

Famous during the bonalu season. Bonalu here are called also as Lashkar bonalu. People coming by car could face parking problem but by two wheeler it is easily accessible and you can park your bike behind the temple or nearby.
It is one of the oldest temple in the city and most reverred by the locals.

There is old story behind this Temple, which I am not sure of it's authenticity. It was built during times when Hyderabad had full-fledge military base in sainikpuri. It bought lot faith among army people.later it was shifted to Secunderabad because sainikpuri had space limitations and army restrictions. Today it is located in Secunderabad, a well known spot in commercial area surrounded by textile shops and gold-silver article dealers. suggest you to reach here via taxi or two-wheeler since it doesn't have much parking space or wider roads.Its a crowded place during weekdays. The temple has lots of positivity in and around.

A historic holy and spiritual place near Charminar in Hyderabad. A few regulations are made on the dress code since it's a religious place. Well maintained and is kept clean and tidy. Many ancient things are present here.

It is open place for all types of religion people. The architecture is very beautiful and can't resist our eyes to watch. Some people will enjoy the prayer's and some will enjoy by watching the birds. There are many nearby places here to visit. Almost all the time of a day is full of crowd.

historical Masjid. inside masjid not allowed renovation work is happening. all humans are allowed inside the campus, u can enjoy the place with water fountain and more pigeons are there.luggage not allowed inside. there is a cloak room near security room with less charge
A place where you meet history and modern world together...it gives you a divine mental peace and the cities conondrum. The serenity is really awesome.good place to go

It is believed that Bricks used in construction of this masjid are made from the clay which was bought from the muslims holy place MECCA. It is one of the largest mosques in South India which accommodates nearly 10,000 people. Masjid is made up of finest quality of granite.

Attended the service couple of times. Sunday they have two services: first one is at 8:30am and second one is at 10:30am. Service is for 90 minutes and it is only English. They use the pipe organ which is wonderful to listen to during the first service. I could see more people coming in for the first service compared to the second service.

They have giant screens so you don't have to look at the book for hymns/Bible reading. Choir can be better, suggest they get someone to play the pipe organ for the second service as well. Message was good. They do provide light snacks after both services.

Other than it being a 200 year old church, the architecture is plain and simple, long pillars, and white colored paint all over. Part of the church was bombed during WW2 and since then they didn't have the pipe organ. Only recently have they fixed it for their 200 years celebration. 

Plenty of parking space available and they have a small heritage center as well.

We've been here, even though we only see from the outside. Unfortunately there is no misa in the church, maybe we are allowed to watch it.

The building is cool, maintained very well with the age of the building that has been hundreds of years. Salute to the Penang government & church administrators.
Kind of cool if you like old Anglican Churches, but unless you are, I wouldn't go out of my way to see it.  If  you're in the neighborhood anyway, might as well go by. We couldn't go inside.

This Anglican church, built 200 years ago, is well-maintained & surrounded by greenery. Listed as one of the country's 50 national treasures, the St George's church underwent  a major restoration in 2009.
Its picturesque setting provides a perfect backdrop for photos, especially for couples marrying at the church.

Big church building even on big piece of land.  Location is also on a prime land. The field is green and huge area. What is so special of this big white church building is... its 199 years old. Yes its going 200 years in 2019. Wow.

Very new and chic place. You can take your kids there on the weekends if you live nearby, it has very modern park equipment. And you should go in the evenings , the sunset is amazing. Also for joggers , this place has non paved running track which is good for knees.

One and only lake in Madhapur. Recently the lake has been cleaned and the hanging bridge is being constructed. Running/walking track along with open air gym is also being constructed. Looking awesome now.

Recently renovated Lake area. Very nice place to spend some quality time with friends, family, and kids. There were lots of. Games and slides for kids. It is still underdevelopment but worth to visit this place. They charge an entry fee of Rs.10 per head for adults.
Metro construction is going on at rock/hill area. Children play zone is well maintained. Kids will enjoy a lot.

The Durgam Cheruvu is a quiet little lake located right in the heart of Hyderabad City. It is a freshwater lake that sports a stunning well-manicured landscape. The place is an ideal spot to go for a picnic with your loved one.

The lake is surrounded by granite rocks that are approximately 2500 years old which add to the scenic beauty of the stunning lake.

Address: Close to Hitech City, Hyderabad
Getting better, but still polluted because waste water getting mixed from the nearby houses . Municipality should take more actions for its conservation
Good place... but not that neat surroundings
Silent place beautiful location...
It was a good place to spend some free time, with  pleasant environment.
Not maintained properly, mosquitoes are everywhere, need maintenance for preserving this lake.

Good place evening time pass...
It's centrally located in the heart of the city in Banjara Hills...and they have massive space for Car Parking....
A beautifully landscaped park with all the basic amenities like food court, children's play area, water pond, jogging cum walking track and much more...

Entry fee is ₹10. Opens from 8:00 to 19:30. Maintenance is well and good. Full of greenery and also some of the colourful couples comes here. Some of them are crossing the limits. May be due to this some families fear to come with their children. A good playing systems for the kids too. As if I went here in the noon i have seen plenty of the people. Such that considering the conditions here i give only 3 star rating to it.

According to spaces it's good for walking but walking around drainage is bad for health. Here in this park I regularly observed a dog(pic was uploaded) seems he was missed or may be dumped, he is extremely human friendly and very cute and good dog, if someone interested in him please adopt him and give a good life.

The park is located at the heart of the city and is easy to commute, the entry fee  is 10rs  per adult. The park has a huge water body in the middle of the park for boating, it has some fastfood area along with kids  play area filled with sand.

maintenance is poor, the food court is not well equipped to serve the purpose. The boating is non operating for a very long time.

This place is like a breath of fresh air in the city... only park where parents from stand along buildings can conveniently take their kids for recreations... beautifully landscaped garden with a water body right in between is a beauty to behold... they just need to maintain the water body to keep up the place...

It's nice to have a place like this in heart of city. It's a good walking track. Best thing is u have a beautiful masjid. The place needs to be more clean. Thanks govt of Telangana for maintaining such a beautiful place.

Beautiful all around.
Lovely trees and flowers.
Lots of homeless seem to get shelter around.
Well maintained.
Small canteens on either sides.

I go here for a morning run. It's an OK place but not extraordinary as there is greenery but can be a lot better. The crowd is elderly and old people and a handful of youngsters.

There are many people at different places in the park who play badminton everyday. I have played quite a bit with them and they are all really great players, at least the ones who come everyday.

One thing to note it, if some day, there is an Assembly meeting, you might not be allowed in the gardens that day.

Nampally public garden are very well maintained and the greenery is so awesome that I was not able to leave the place. 
Public gardens are very large and very spacious and it's unbelievable that it is in the centre of the city.
The only thing you need to pay for Is for  the parking and toilets
Very nice place to enjoy. A spacious garden. Nice place to hangout with family and friends.

One of the over crowded cafe I have seen.          It is famous for it's tea and biscuits.                    Can try other items like puffs samosas etc.        Those who are going to and coming from railway station can enjoy tea here.                      There is no parking. the

Ocean of customers visit this place. Really a great place for foodies and travellers to have a quality food at a cheaper price affordable to everyone. The food provided is also delicious and  great in quality. Serving by the employs is also so comfortable and polite. Loved my visit there. Frequent visitor to this place only for food. 
I request Food freaks to pay a visit to this place.
Near to Secunderabad railway station. Very old hotel. When I was a child my parents would take me there. Tea is good. Dining hall on 1st floor is spacious and food quality is superb.

Alpha hotel is equally for low level and medium level people.  
On ground floor, you get all bakery items, tea,  cool drink,  desert etc at moderate rate (self service).  There,  tables are arranged to stand and eat. This bay will be crowded. Next to that you have some area arranged with table and seats. Main course will be served there. 
On first floor,  you have well arranged facility with cushioned seats and tables. Prices are lightly higher than the ground floor. Whenever I had from there taste was good. 
The thing I don't like in Alpha is,  waiters are begging us for tip sometime or they already tell us the amount including their tip.  People will give tip when they like the way they are served. Other thing,  they arrange the premises,  more hygienic.

Some traffic here while going to this hotel , who were walking with kids and children too much of care is needed.
Tasty food is available here.
Good accommodation.

Affordable prices. A good place for non vegetarian food lovers. Good Ambience. 

Can be located easily. 

Vegetarian food eaters, you have less options here, but good taste. It is fine trying out food here.

Cost for 2 - 500 to 600/-

Only issue is delayed Service. Otherwise everything is fine.

Didn't live up to the hype. The quantity of food was more than sufficient, but the meat pieces in the food was not the usual quantity. Maybe because they were maintaining a low price compared to Paradise. We ordered Biriyani & rice was more, meat very less. The non AC area was like a public food shed - crowded and tight in the open. We didn't try the AC area.
Taste keeps up with the hype. Price is also acceptable. Service is also nice. Nice ambience. Suitable to visit with friends as well as family. Would definitely recommend.

There are two outlets opposite to each other. One is a takeaway and the other is an restaurant. Restaurant is decently maintained and has family crowds too. Valet parking too is available which is a big boost to the place, since legacy Biryani outlets don’t provide such services. Food is well done, giving a 3 since the washrooms could have been better or else would have been a 4. It’s open all day.

Place to go to if you want Paradise quality food but with a better ambience. The dishes are kind of copied from Paradise, but the result is good. So who cares. Kids were happy with the wide Chinese choices. I wish parking was easier to find and they kept their toilets cleaner. Overall 5 Stars all the way.

The reason for one star less is shifting from nicely suiting copper glasses for water and regular water to plastic bottles :-(. Very disappointing to see more restaurants taking up more usage of single use plastic while there are more and more awareness drives to reduce the same.
That said, the restaurant for its purpose, I would rate it 5*s 
Tasty food, large portions, quick and friendly staff. Even the waiting time and crowd (which is the situation most dining hours) is managed well.

Visited this place as I heard lot of things about  the same... It matched expectations completely. Tasty and authentic south Indian  food with mouth watering varieties of chutneys..not to forget,  service  and ambience  were also great...
Great food with great flavors. The idly texture is just a next level. Steamed dosa just explode in the mouth. Definitely the sweets, tangy, spicy n yummy chutneys are the heroes on the table.

Over hyped establishment for breakfast. Tastes the same as a breakfast vendor down your street. If you want to spend an extra 100 bucks for no damn reason other than sitting on a sofa while being served, then go for it. Average at best. You can't be charging ₹180 for a mango milkshake and serve a shake with artifical syrup in it and expect a decent outcome. Can't recommend.
Nice place for a family dinner. Good ambience also. Tried the North Indian thali. The food kept coming and coming as it was unlimited. Great service too. Pricing is $$.

The worst place it have food!! It was a night mare for the dishes. They have boiled the food and got it from the fridge. Hospitality was miserable. The dish was kept on the table and were left on our own. We had it our selves. At the time of leaving the place the waiter would ask TIP without hesitation. Even if u say the service is not good they will not move from our face. Strongly not recommended.

The interior is exquisite and there's also a outdoor dining available (only dinner). Nice place to dine but quality of food doesn't match up to the lavish design. Missing elements (like garnishing) stick out as a sore thumb in particular.
Food is good. Ambience was also good. Nice place enjoy a dinner in open
Food is good, particularly chicken starters and biryani. Ambience is average. Prefer garden sitting. Washrooms are unclean.
I am going there  since  my first date 6 years with my hubby its really good..n good staff
Awesome biryani. Best quality meat is used. Well priced. But service is slow
Delightful like every time. This restaurant is small but tidy and hygienic. Nice restaurant to have a biryani on the way to Hyderabad Airport.

Appetizers to desserts everything was tasty.... Specially both mutton and chicken biryani's were  amazing 👍😋👌.... Very decent atmosphere. Need to improve their service. The food quality was good. Cashless transaction is available. Car parking is also available....try to reduce the music sound. The sound was little high and disturbing.
So good! Paradise has the best biryani! This branch is out of the city and that's why it is very peaceful! Food is outstanding as always.
Very nice food that will intend your delicious reliciousness . Quick service. Good staff. Nothing more to say.

I like the hospitality of the people, ambience is also good. It's always spicy n hot(chilly) even if you selected zero spicy food. For non habituated person it's really tough time to enjoy your food. Overall it was nice experience with great food and nice hospitality.

Too costly. Spacious. Valet parking available.
Many items are very spicy. They charged Rs.44/- for water bottle, where it should have been Rs.19/-. We went as group (10 persons) and had buffet and they provided mineral water bottles. We thought its part of buffet. In the end, they charged Rs.44/- for each water bottle. They should have asked us before providing those. When we asked about this, they said that it is the price in their restaurant. 
Brinjal curry is too spicy. Out of 4 veg starters, 1 was good. In non-veg, starters tasted good and main course is average. Veg main course is below average. I will not recommend this.
Only for who love spicy foods. they should have maintains quality for sea foods. Some times we are getting the sand  in fish curry.

Very nice ambience and good quality of food with decent service.

But have a word about preference like medium spicy etc.

Staffs are polite and well behaved, order also won't take much time to appear on the table. A variety of food in Rayalaseema flaour are available here and those are delicious (judging as an eggetarian). Rate is a bit higher, in compare to other rivals of it.

Food is good. Manager is cooperative. Major problem no parking and ambience. Inside sit in restaurant atmosphere is very dull and dark, seats are not good they smell stinky. They should completely change the interiors and make atmosphere lively. Service at self service is very bad. With bare hands they touching food.  Cleanliness has to be maintained which is lacking. My three stars are for taste, manager, fastness in serving.

Good and tasty food  South and North Indian.   Be careful while taking tokens and paying cash.  It happened several times that the cashier short changed me. Upon asking they say they were confused. If you don't check and don't ask you lose the money.
Amazing breakfast... 4 of us had some 7 plates of food. Utterly delicious.
The place is decent and clean. The meals and Chinese food in this place is amazing. Prices are reasonable.
Staff behaviour is not good with customers but the quality of food is good need to improve packaging condition's

Awesome food taste... The ambience was classy.... 
We went there on a working day and the corn on toast is a must try for all... 
Te
He atmosphere is electric 
The summers are the best time to hangout and The Taj is the  best place to hangout with widespread menu
The buffet is affordable and taste is mind-blowing 
Try it guys.... I'm sure you won't be disappointed....

Great vegetarian restaurant. It has Indian and Asian both cuisines. There was varieties of  North and South Indian dishes, and many varieties of dessert and the taste was awesome. I found this to be one of the finest Buffet options for Vegetarians. It is located in banjara hills opposite city centre mall. It's a well maintained restaurant with adequate parking space. If you are pure Veg Lover and you will enjoy this place. Quality of Food and service is good. This place is neat and clean With good ambience.

For all who has been frequently visiting Taj Mahal Hotel at Abids, this one is a branch of the same. Excellent food and authentic taste. Service is wonderful. Valet parking is available. Value for money.

A wonderful place to gorge on some delicious stuff, with the variety of disaster standing out. Add to this the very courteous staff and the location, you can't ask for more. However, a small suggestion. A lot of senior citizens visit this place and they should be served items selected by them when they prefer to go for buffet at the table. Given their advanced age they find it difficult to balance the loaded plates, everytime they need refill.

The food is good. But i feel the ambience is not up to the mark. Especially the flooring does not give u a good feel. The service is good. When we visited they had avial which was really good. The atmosphere is quite cozy but for the flooring.
Great place to eat. Perfect place to take your family. Food is also great. The 'Tawa Fish Fry' is rocking !!
Standard has been drastically reduced. It was no where near to the one I had few years back. Food are unnecessarily costly
The food quality and service has been deteriorated over years. Better options are available like flechazo in the same buffet price range.

This place is in the city centre mall, parking is available in the mall cellar and is not much crowded unless it is weekend. 

They generally serve buffet and is slightly overpriced for the items they serve for both veg and non veg. 
Food is decent and didnot have much to impress and get to 5 stars. Paani poori is what i liked most here. 
Staff is friendly and courteous. 
Ambience is really awesome and gives you a feel of the retro dhaba setup. 
Overall its a one time visit.
They have a great spread with a variety of options in veg and non-veg. The staffs are very courteous. Ambience is good. Reasonable cost.

Great atmosphere. Food is okay, not as good as veg delights, but this place has a bar.

Charges extra 16.5% on top of food price. Means you're looking at a minimum of 10,000 per person for food and a drink. Rice is 2000mwk for a small bowl...

Went few days ago,
Awesome food best restaurant in Blantyre
I enjoy the Indian dishes at Bombay Palace

Has an amazing Indian cuisine. Their chicken lollipops are mouth watering.  Although their opening hours are a bummer if you're craving for Indian food in the morning or at 3 in the afternoon. But overall, their atmosphere and food is superb
first place to ever try Indian cousin

Today the food was good. 
The taste has come back to the old times.

In middle this place had lost its taste but they r now back in action.

Will recommend you all to try the food here.

Nothing to say great.  The food was OK so was the ambience.  I doubt they have enough parking.  The rating in dine out app was 4.6 but I doubt if it really lives up to it.  I would give it 3 for ambience and 2.5 for food at most. 
Look out for better options in the area,  there are many.

Hidden treasure. The food was very good. The ambience was pleasing

The crispy cauliflower was very good. Veg Manchurian was also interestingly differentlh prepared and good.

The serving size and comparatively lower price (as compared to the more touted authentic Chinese places) made it an overall enjoyable meal.
Amazing food, any dish tastes superb, awesome hospitality. One of the best restaurant for Chinese lovers. Good place to hangout for family friends & couples .... loved it

It's a great place to enjoy Chinese food.. both veg and non veg. It's there for over a decade serving great taste. It's not very expensive but taste is equal to any expensive place. Good ambience, very courteous staff, fast service... Overall it's a great experience. They have valet parking as well.

Its nice and cool place. For soup lovers, its the delicious and cheapest place.....
Comfortable family zone. And the price ranges for other food are reasonable. 
This is my second time visiting this place for Soup.
I have visited this place many times and always found best and Improved management practices here. Food Quality is Excellent.  A perfect place for families.

A typical example of typical business man mentality. Wonderful ambiance with worst washroom services. No water in the washrooms, dirtiest possible condition. Totally unattended washrooms. They should concentrate more on washrooms than their food and restaurants atmosphere.

A superb place to eat and spend beautiful moments with family and friends. The quality of food is quite good. Mutton and Chicken karahi were tasty and the soup was also quite good. It's a must visit in bahawalpur.
Neat/Clean and very good presentation. Need improvement in Taste. Some meals were hot as per requirement. Prices are high as compared to others equally categorized restaurants.

Frankly I had never been to a Mainland China before. But this place made me wished why didn't I do that. We had ordered Noodles and Rice, exotic vegetable gravy and spring rolls. Everything tasted really good. Service was excellent. The ambience serves as a really nice place to go for a lunch/dinner with family.

A great place for a team lunch or family outing. They have buffet at reasonable rates every day if the week.  Situated in church landing road it is easily accessible from most of the parts of the city.  The metro exit extends right into the road.  It is a one way and would be better to reach there in an auto or car

The buffet was simply completely off the mark. They had 3 non vegetarian starters, a main course with non vegetarian gravies - you need to have then with veg fried rice or noodles. 

I would have been fine if the starters tasted very good but it was not the case. A fish starter was good but none of the others. Now for the reason for 2 stars Ave not less... Their ice tea was fantastic and all my colleagues agreed their cocktails were nice. Another star because they asked for our feedback and got some prawns that tasted nice.

I suggest you skip the buffet here. Not worthy of 900+ per head.

First time to mainland China.. eye soothing decor, peaceful ambience.. delicious food.. courteous service.. but kept asking feedback for every dish served which kinda bothered.. hence a star less from 5.. overall fine dine experience by leaders..

I had always heard the hype about Mainland China but had not got a chance to try for so many years. So finally couple of weeks back we dropped in here for lunch unplanned. Luckily we got the table without having to wait. 

So we took buffet lunch & starters were served on table. I loved the fish in starters & chicken was also nice. In veg there was potato & corn dishes which was ok. Few beverages were part of buffet & I took lime juice which was very strong lime juice, definitely good when having buffets(for diet conscious !! ) :P Jokes apart !! next took the main course chicken fried rice was authentically Chinese which I had not tasted else where. Also other dishes were authentic Chinese saucy dishes which was tasty & great Chinese food. Dessert section had the mousses, cakes & ice creams which was the usual ones. I was hoping to see some Chinese desserts which would make it a complete Chinese food ! At the end they gave a Chinese tea which was good too!

Ambiance is great & loved the interior decors. Cost for food was worth it.

Great food, as a vegetarian i highly recommend their Manchow Soup for the beginning and their Chilly Stick Vegetable for starters is a must try. Veg Chilly Garlic Noodles and their Fried Rice served in Bamboo Shoots is a must try. The best part is their consistence in the taste and quality of the food, is impeccable. Been a regular visitor for over 2 decades now, a nice place where we as a family and friends have many memories to cherish.

It is one of the finest Chinese restaurants in town. We ordered veg noodles, veg fried rice and veg Manchurian. The taste was as always good. The portion size is large. The prices are quite reasonable 

The decor is same for many years. It is time that it goes for an upgrade.

My favourite Chinese restaurant in Hyderabad...amazing food..comfortable and relaxing ambience.. shezwan noodles, fried rice in bamboo..yummy snacks..and at the end of the meal .. the fortune cookies... I  love reading them..would recommend to friends and family.. overall a very good experience.there was a staff whose name is Prakash he is with us from the time entered to the end. He is a amazing guy. No attitude always ☺ smile on his face.. .

Excellent food.. Great service, the staffs are so good the food is completely authentic Chinese..... Many variety to eat, there was a staff member whose name was Jaganath he was there with us from the time we entered to the time we left.... The staffs have no attitude always a smile on its face.... Loved the ambience very calm and relaxing.. I would really recommend this to all the people and for them who love Chinese.....

Food is great, very close to authentic Chinese cuisines. Ambience is fine but space is a bit constricted. People serving there are very polite but slow. 
If you are looking for a relaxed evening with plenty of time with you and you are craving for some Chinese dishes, this is one of the places in Hyderabad to go to.
Great ambience and sophisticated food. Buy discounted vouchers from little app or nearbuy. Lots of dessert options... Enjoy.

Comfortable seating,wide variety of continental, indian food with lovely service.. came here for an afternoon buffet and was pleasantly surprised. The dessert section is a must try with the chef doling out 12 delicacies..

A normal cafe with buffet food.... Don't I repeat please don't expect anything fancy of the standards that Marriott promises... It's just a very average one with about 1 veg snacks in afternoon and 2 snacks in dinner... Max 2 vegetables in main course are edible and mostly tasteless... Sweets are okay okay... Fruits are the best thing I found here
It's worth a visit once with coupons from dine out. Not worth if no coupons

Exceptional variety of foods including items from continental, Indian, and Hyderabadi regional cuisine. All food items taste really fresh and delicious. Very professionally served. Friendly stuff always make you feel like home. Kudos team MoMo café

The service and the food were both great. Our server's name was Jodie, and she never let my glass or my breadsticks basket go empty. She was friendly, and gave me suggestions when I didn't know what to order. I tried the unlimited pasta lunch, and paid extra for shrimp. It was delicious, and definitely worth it. I love the peach tea they have here too. I got the chocolate lasagna dessert to go because I was stuffed. We still have lots of leftovers for dinner. Will definitely go here again.

Waitress was one of the best I've ever had. She was on point with everything from the time we were seated, drinks,appetizers,meal she killed it all around. Definitely recommend this place an will return again myself.

I placed an order to go via the phone. When I arrived, there was plenty of handicap parking. I was greeted promptly when entering the restaurant and they immediately went and got the order. to put it on the counter and as she showed it to me to verify the order was correct, she placed it in the bag. it was a nice and smooth experience and I will definitely be going back. The food was very good as well.
Our server Lindsey was amazing. She was always close by and she gave us good suggestions. Was excellent service by far
Food was really good.   The server was amazing!! So well mannered and made sure we always had everything.

Very good restaurant with great Punjabi dishes. Most of the items tastes very nice, and prices are worth to the taste, vegetarians too have a lot of options!! Good seating and decent ambience, well mannered staff too. Overall a good restaurant to consider for North Indian cuisine.

Food is delicious. Good thing is that you can call and reserve the seats. Otherwise you have to wait in queue. Veg and non-veg all are available and everything is tasty. Prices are a bit high but comparable to the tasty food you get. Can hangout with friends and family. One should must try lassi here.

If you are looking for authentic Punjabi food then you should visit to this place. I am giving five stars to food taste and food quality. Ambience is not that good but this restaurant is very costume effective. Get ready for mouthwatering menu.
the place offers a very good variety of punjabi dishes. the taste is marvelous. it is a must try for all the non veg lovers. worth the money
Food is decent at best. Atmosphere is non-existent. Washroom facilities are horrendous. You'd be safer washing your hands after you get home.

You would love the ambience for sure, no question about it! If you are a party of more than 4, then you would have to adjust on the platform and won't get reservation inside the train, but it's okay, you can take pictures later! Haha..
Coming to food, NEVER EVER order a platter in starters! They charge exorbitant price for nothing- like 2k for non veg platter which suffices mere 3 ppl and 1.5k for Veg!!! Keep away from committing this mistake and you ll enjoy the food there!
Drinks were fine, we ordered mocktails and everything was above average.
Food is on the spicy side, so I enjoyed the main course though people not used to spicy might need some water!
The dessert sampler was delightful as well! ☺
Do visit but be wary of platters!

Great ambiance here. As it is at all places, theme is based on railway. So if you're in a group of 4 or less, you will get a reservation for having food inside train. Food quality is good, a bit on spicy side, which I like. Price wise, it is a bit on expensive side, which makes your wallet lighter.

Nice ambiance. The restaurant is modeled after a train station from the 1960s(?). You can choose to sit on the railway station platform or in the train cars. There is train announcements too! The food is really tasty and very easy to go overboard! Chicken dishes suggested by the waiter was finger-licking good.

The ambiance and food were excellent. I really enjoyed it. They have an exotic menu themed after old British India.
Service could be improved though. They served me a nan when I ordered a kulcha and were making lots of noise near my table talking/coordinating between themselves.

The order was served after 30 minutes. Not that it had very fancy and intricate items. Just a couple of Indian non-veg dishes. The ingredients were good but the preparation lacked the punch. Hardly anything to relish about. And finally, the heaviest part of the lunch, the bill. Net to net, it was a disappointment.
Great traditional South Indian food. Good ambience. Would have been better if they had some live singing or music performances in the traditional Southern states style as well
Love the ambience here. Would recommend this 100%. Food s very tasty. Perfect south indian food. Costly but worth it.
Best place for South Indian curry. Excellent ambience and friendly staff. Only downside is comes with a price tag
I have been hear form 2002 and its a delight the servings and the food hits the mark every time and the ambiance has changed in a tone which we will not be able to notice.
Food, ambience and service is top notch. I think they just need to add variety to the menu otherwise everything was great.
They have good music, and the place is good for hookah I'm not sure if they still serve it or no. As the name suggests its on a terrace, have good seating and the food is average.

Sheesha Lovers- Don't miss to pay a visit to this place at any cost!!!!! 

If you are a Non Local, Visit this place for a puff of Smoke anytime after 7.. you'll fall in love with this place 😊
What a beautiful place ya , dishes also Delicious ..

After reading lot of positive reviews we went for a lunch today. We reached there by 1:45 and by 2:15 we realized that those reviews are well framed paid or fake reviews. We went there with Groupon coupons. Coming to the menu...

Soup: some veg soup (I don't even remember the name), chicken soup (sliced boiled chicken in the same veg soup)

Starters: They served us Aloo 65, Veg Pakoda (They call it crispy veg!), Chicken Manchuria and Chilli Chicken. First serving (5-6 pcs) was boneless. When we asked for the 2nd serving (4 to 5 pcs), almost every piece has a bone.  When we asked for the 3rd serving, the server gave a weird look (trust me, you don't even feel like asking for the 4th serving after that powerful weird look.)

Salads: Sliced onions, carrots and keera (They call them veg salads!) Onions with curd (This must be a economical replacement to aloo with cream salad that's usually served in most of the buffets). Lots of sliced tomato with little chicken in it (They call it chicken salad!)

Main course: Egg masala and fish curry with bones. Chicken biryani, raita (a mixture of 3/4 water and 1/4th curd with sliced green chillies and onion), michi ka salan. Noodles, White rice, dal, sambar, veg fry, curd, papad and pickels.

Desserts: Semiya payasam, cut fruits(papaya and water melon), vanila ice cream.

Highlights: For the first time in the history of mankind, I saw a hotel (that too a hotel located n prime location like somajiguda) without minimum required cutlery. They don't have a scoop for serving ice cream. We have to use a spoon for that. They don't even have dessert bowls. We have to use disposable plastic cups and spoons for that. And the most interesting part is, we have to use long handled spoons for serving rice, biryani and even sambar!! All those spoons matches the size of the spoon we use to eat the food. So if you know that you are going to eat 5 spoons, you can just serve 5 spoons and thus reduce food wastage. What an !dea sir ji... If you want to eat roti, you have to eat with egg masala coz fish curry is with bones and you never know what fish they have used (one chicken curry is the minimum expectation to have with roti). Groupon says 2 deserts and we though once should be at least gulab jamun. But we were shocked to see semiya payasam and cut fruits.

Conclusion: I have been to Silk Route (Banjara hills), Best Western Ashoka (Lakdikapul), 36 Dakshin (Madhapur), Celebrations (Jubilee Hills), Ebony (Banjara hills), 45 Jubilee Hills etc., which are in the same price range and they are good in at least one dish they make. So I never bothered to write a review. But now, after experiencing Hop at Terrace bay, I feel like sharing my experience so that I can save few people from falling into their reviews trap. To conclude, This is the WORST buffet I ever had and they ruined my B'day party. :( :( :(
Excellent food and ambience. friendly staff

Centrally situated at Ammerpet this High quality Four Star hotel with well furnished rooms and services.  You will find it a delight to stay. Courteous staff and reasonable tariff are added attractions. It has a good restaurant which offers heavy  complimentary buffet breakfast. 
Good car parking and nice reception hall are available. Cards are accepted. Recommended for stay with family.
Attended a workshop at the hotel then went for dinner. Service was good. Food items are tasty. Ambience and cleanliness is very good

Tulip is a good restaurant which is a part of Green park hotel. Service is good, food quality is average.We went to have buffet, but some of the item like fried rice was became so hard. Double ka mitha was not good. I felt they can increase the quality of good more as per what they are charging (Inr- 850 pp).
Loved our midnight dinner here. The best part of buffet was Paya and Haleem. Otherwise, Biryani and curries were average in taste.
Value for money. Less crowded and polite staff

It's open in Swiggy for home delivery.

One of the finest pure vegetarian restaurant in Hyderabad.  The quality of food is excellent and the cost is very reasonable. Their food packing too is excellent. 

U gotta try their Panner tikka masala, and masala kulcha it's the BEST. 

Their fried rice too is good....

If u like lil sweetish Malai kofta is pure saucy sweet ....

Their veg Manchurian is perfectly cooked.
Best place for vegetation's
Why did you close it . I miss it .

For all vegetarians, the right place buffet :D where you can have a whole range of dishes to eat at an appropriate price. I have been to ohris many times but enjoyed the food here a lot. 5 star would be less.
Decent spread for a buffet. The queue at the place can be better managed.

One of the best restaurants I have ever visited. Ambience of restaurant is excellent. It is a good destination for romantic dinner. Taste and quality of  food are awesome. The staffs' behaviour is also very good. And finally, the cost was reasonable.

Last night when I visited this place, we sat outdoors on tables with candle light and Hyderabad had a rainy clinate with pleasant breeze blowing over which multiplied the beauty of this place. 

The food is yummy as usual. Anything you eat there is the best. Only that i found their staff rude. They need to work on the behavior of their waiters so that it's a happy experience for the diners.

All in all, its a must try and one of the few places that have romantic ambiences in Hyderabad

One of the best buffets in the city of Hyderabad. The ambience of this place is really refreshing and real. You get to enjoy a nice view of the city, sprinklers keep you protected from heat and the food tastes yummy! I'm a vegetarian and I had a great experience at Exotica with delicious starters and widespread main course. The service is friendly and welcoming. Best place for a lunch or dinner in the area with reasonable buffet prices and great food.

Ambiance is too good. One can enjoy time spending in Zafran. There are wide variety of starters in veg, they have few starters in non veg, and tastes good. Service is good too... They are quick. As per my taste.. Main course is not up to the mark. There is more to improve in main course. Desserts are decent. Overall experience is good.

Taste and quality of starters are good. Buffet spread may not look huge considering what other restaurants are offering. Summer is already here but we still enjoyed the lunch in the outside terrace without any issue. Water vapor based cooling arrangement did its job quite well. For those who need a pan to conclude a meal, there is one vendor waiting right outside the lift lobby in ground floor.
Awesome place. Service is real good. Food tastes good. Friendly staff. Drinks available. They have daily offers on drinks. Make sure to check out the outside boards for offers.
Wine on the menu not available! Really shocking. Incomprehensible for a luxury hotel. Service below par.
Their afternoon brunch on Sundays is a feast fit for royals - everything is always perfect!
Wonderful ambiance , really sublime fine dining experience
nice place
The menu is festures cuisines of Telengana and Hyderabad prominently, along with some representation of other coastal cuisines. The cooking is nice and homely.

It has grown so much since I was young..still beautiful. Lake Champlain . The only reason it was never listed as a great lake is because u can see the other side. But,it was big enough. I was born in VT. & spent many years on & off there. Lake Champlain is a place for BBQ'S, swimming & just  escaping. Having family & or friends fun.
We always love coming down here for a walk or just to play in the field with the kids. All year they have fun stuff going on usually, kids day, fourth of July with fireworks, tons of events.
The sun is shining, a breeze is blowing, and the lake is frozen over from shore to shore. It's an amazing day on the waterfront in Burlington!

This is a great place to watch the sunset. There are lots of show's during the summer,wide variety of shops, dispensary, ferry, awesome bike path, short ride to North Beach. There is a dog park, skatepark, lots of places to sit, wheelchair accessible and lots of grass to walk on, parking,boat ramps docks, playground.

Great spot on the Lake in downtown Burlington.  Convenient to parking, docks, a waterfront walking trail, Skinny Pancake crepe shop and the Leahy museum.  More than a bit cold in the winter but usually delightful in the summer and fall.  Short walk uphill to everything in downtown Burlington, a great spot to visit.
One of the best rooftop bar and restaurant in had here for meetup party from Google. Had great time here. Loved everything :)
Awesome ambience. Great food. Perfect place for a lovely evening
Good ambience. Good service. Complete worth of money.

Let me start with this: The first two starters they served were: Dosa & Bhel Puri. Yes! What the hell! They had total 4 veg starters and 2 non-veg starters. And, main course seriously lacked variety. Desserts were okay. 

But, service was not up to the mark at all. The staffs are not attentive, unapologetic. And, that makes this place not worth of spending 600 bucks. Yes, not worth.

Will cost you 300 to 400 rupees for coffee for two people with taxes.Well located. Good coffee. More that good coffee good food. Weekday place rather than weekend.

But it lacks in customer service. Just because our team our team could get the order in by 4 pm they denied the advetized discount.

Staff needs more training. Seating needs an upgrade for more comfort.

The place is on the main line with many other food joints nearby. They have a kids place and tables and sofas of same height. The menu is same across all the joints of chocolate room. Some shakes are refreshing but can really work upon the rest. Service is good, the background music is fine. 
Food options are okay for snack purpose. Waffle is nice. 
You can give a visit once and enjoy a calm time as it's not overcrowded.

Really a good experience whenever we visit the chocolate room. Melting chocolate with any combination is awesome. If we order a sundae two members can have this sufficiently. Recommended place for chocolate lovers 😋

I m never going to visit this place again unless I m craving for Smoking Chocolate Brownie stuff. We had white sauce pasta and it was very bad quality. I make better than them. It wasn’t creamy, buttered at all.

Place have good ambiance.
Gold benefits are eligible even on shakes.
We ordered shakes on sunny day.
Service is slow, we have to go to service counter and asked twice for taking order.
Smoothies are okish, they are not thick shakes.
Pricing 3/5
Ambiance 4/5
Location 5/5
Service 2/5
Cafe is so nice

Great food. Amazing value. Parking availability is very good. Tried out the cookies in addition to the  regular lunch options. Not priced at a premium yet great quality. Recommended by our cab driver and I'm happy I made the right choice. They took exceptional care to understand if we are satisfied with the service. Highly recommended
Place is quiet. Service staff are courteous and attend promptly. Food is good, little bit more spicy than expected. Mutton Biryani is good. Punjabi Chicken is excellent.
Good ambience . Good food . Could have been better. Visited twice In a week . First time the starters Apollo fish and spicy chicken were awesome.  Second time the  chicken was not fresh.

It's always a great place in Hyderabad where you can hangout with your friends and family. The service and the food especially is absolutely spell bound and always mouth-watering and a delicious treat. Love to go and check out this place. I am sure you're gonna love it too!!
Veg biryani was very very spicy. Cutlery was dirty. No serving spoon for vinegar. Waiter brought the bill even before we were going to order sweet dish.

This bakery is my favorite choice the quality and quantity is both top notch and cheery on the cake is the pricing very reasonable. The only downside is that it's not really a family bakery wherein you can sit an enjoy with due to space constraints. However, this days SWIGGY is doing a good job. I live nearby so any bakery items comes to my home comes from here.
Must visit. The food is amazing. The service is best in class... Sevice is at par with the best.. the staff is amazing.
Good Bakery Products !! Had quick Bite of Chicken Puff and Cool Drink. It also has got Fantastic Cakes and Pastries. Located Exactly Opp to Care Hospital. Banjara Hills

A nice place for Hyderabadi non-veg food. But brace yourself for a long wait to get a table. The service is poor and a bit unprofessional in spite having captains, a la Hyderabad "ishtyle". Don't dare to travel in your car. Not even a two wheeler since you will be going in circles to find parking space. Wondering why you need to select this place then? For the tasty food.
Excellent food and service but only problem is parking both bikes & cars.

Our regular hotel when staying in Bangkok, it has rarely disappointed us through our 10+ stays.
Staff is polite and service minded, front desk is usually quick and rooms are nice and, compared to many European hotels, quite spacious.
Big thanks to Suparp and the rest of the guys that greet us when arriving and help with our luggage. Always polite, smiling and service minded.
Breakfast restaurant is good with a huge variety of food, although I prefer to go outside for the local Bangkok taste!

The location is wonderful, right in the city center. Service is good, the staffs are quite helpful. Nice and clean, although a bit small.

Restaurants available everywhere and close to multiple malls like Siam center, Siam Paragon, MBK. The shopping mega Platinum is also just one station away, or if you don't mind the walk, there's a free walkway that takes you nearby as well.

فندق جميل وعجيب من الخدمه الي السكن في الغراف. وحتي الموظفين محترمين وطيبين وحتي الفندق قريب من المول سيام بركون 
Nice hotel! Great, convenient location. The check in staff were really friendly and helpful. I arrived early but Pump managed to find a room with no fuss and no waiting. Thank you!!
Great staff and service.  Good breakfast with variety. Close to everything.  Would stay here again.  Has a pool and a small gym.  Add pa as well.

This hotel wasn't really that nice. The only upside was its location within walking distance of shopping malls, restaurants, street sellers and markets, massages and salons. Personally won't go back as I didn't feel that comfortable there. Made use of the spa for a for massage which was pretty good.
